results.title: Looking towards the future
results.brief_description: In March 1947 the SS Johan de Witt docked in Sydney with seven hundred Jewish refugees on board. It was the last such mass intake of refugees of the Holocaust and stirred up a degree of anti-Semitism which contributed to the revival of the White Australia policy shortly afterwards. This program combines interviews with three of those on board and archival footage to present an authentic and personal account of the times.

results.title: Looking through glass
results.brief_description: A study of the manufacture of glass in a British factory, where the handcraftsman still applies his art alongside modern mass production methods. A sequence is devoted to a survey of the department of Glass Technology at Sheffield University.

results.title: Looking into Word Processing
results.brief_description: Opening with the voice of a Town Crier, this program introduces the basic concepts behind modern word processing including scrolling, block operations, search and replace and spell-checking.

results.title: Looking into the bits and pieces of a Micro
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to micro computers using non-technical language and shows how the various kinds of hardware and software work together in a computer system. Addresses everything from Central Processing Units (CPU’s) to Random Access Memory (RAM).

results.title: Looking into spreadsheets
results.brief_description: Introduces the basic concepts behind spreadsheets by viewing a sample budget and explaining how it is set up in a typical spreadsheet. Provides excellent preparation for training in the spreadsheet program of your choice.

results.title: Looking into hardware for business computing
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the hardware required to establish a business computer system. Suitable for persons using computers for the first time, those with only a rudimentary knowledge or those training others in their use.

results.title: Looking into Databases: Getting Started with Dbase IV
results.brief_description: This program offers a good introduction to computerised databases. It uses the setting of a modern day library to illustrate the concepts and operations of a database system, showing the advantages over a manual approach. A simple book retrieval system is then constructed using the facilities of dBase 1V.

results.title: Looking for spacethings
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Jason and his dopey companion go looking for a thing from outer space. Meanwhile, a search party for the pair goes astray and Gonzo munches on a shoe. But sooner or later the spaghetti has to be cooked.

results.title: Looking for me
results.creator_credit: Virginia Bartlett and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: A young dance and movement therapist, Janet Adler, presents and illustrates her belief that movement awareness is essential for children, and at times may substitute as a means of communication where normal methods fail or are not possible. Working with body awareness produces new experiences and emotions which eventually lead to a basis for verbal communication.
